importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the timing of the news about Doug Martin's death, which is significant for public awareness and media coverage.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame from 2012 to 2018 covers Martinâ€™s active NFL career, during which he played for the Buccaneers and Raiders, and achieved key milestones like Pro Bowl selections and All-Pro honors.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He recorded 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in his NFL career across six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin also caught 148 passes for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
He earned a Pro Bowl berth in both his rookie year (2012) and 2015, and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers publicly mourned his passing, calling it a 'sudden and unexpected' loss and stating he made a 'lasting impact' on the franchise.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.
The cause of death is currently unconfirmed, and the family has requested privacy during this time.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State, Martin amassed 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over seven seasons, earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors in 2012 and 2015 respectively. He also recorded 148 catches for 1,207 yards. The Buccaneers recognized his legacy by naming him one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. His passing, described as sudden and unexpected, has prompted mourning from the team and fans, with the family requesting privacy regarding the cause of death.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
